intro: Fagraea rodatzii, commonly known as the Philippine star apple, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its ornamental value due to its fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a smooth surface. The fruit is a small, round, star-shaped berry that turns red when ripe.
